meanings.definition: To stab or wound with a knife.
meanings.sent1: He knifed the apple to cut it into slices.
meanings.sent2: The criminal knifed his victim in the dark alley.
meanings.sent3: She playfully knifed the cake at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The cold wind knifed through his thin jacket.
meanings.sent5: The chef expertly knifed the vegetables with precision.

meanings.definition: To cut or carve with a knife.
meanings.sent1: She knifed the paper to make a snowflake.
meanings.sent2: He knifed intricate designs into the wood.
meanings.sent3: The artist knifed a masterpiece out of the clay.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight knifed through the dense forest canopy.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully knifed the steak into perfect portions.
